greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square table, read by antidiagonals, where the g.f. for row n+1 is generated by: x*R_{n+1}(x) = (1+n*x - 1/R_n(x))/(n+1) with R_0(x) = Sum_{n>=0} n!*x^n.
formula: T(n, 0) = 1, T(0, k) = k!, otherwise for n>=1 and k>=1:
T(n, k) = Sum_{j = 0...k} A089949(k, j)*n^(k-j). - _Philippe Deléham_, Aug 08 2005
G.f. of row R may be expressed by the continued fraction: W(0), where W(k) = 1 - x*(k+1)/( x*(k+1) - 1/(1 - x*(k+1+R)/( x*(k+1+R) - 1/W(k+1) ))). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 26 2013
example: Rows are generated by logarithms of factorial series:
G.f. of row n may be expressed by the continued fraction:
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := T[n, k] = Which[n < 0 || k < 0, 0, k == 0 || k == 1, 1, n == 0, k!, True, (T[n - 1, k + 1] - T[n - 1, k])/n - Sum[T[n, j]*T[n - 1, k - j], {j, 1, k - 1}]]; Table[T[n - k, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 18 2018 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 06 2005
